item.title: Self-hosted music streaming on a Raspberry Pi
item.description: I got a Raspberry Pi years ago after finishing GCSE Computing at school and could never quite figure out what to do with it. Recently though I found out about a project called Navidrome: Navidrome is an open source web-based music collection server and streamer. It gives you freedom to listen to your music collection from any browser or mobile device. It’s like your personal Spotify! (from the Github README) It’s compatible with the Subsonic API which is accessible from a number of music player client across mobile, desktop and web platforms.
